data.title: WEDDINGS; Emma McLaughlin, Joel Gibson
data.text:
Emma Lanier McLaughlin and Joel Stanton Gibson were married yesterday in New York. The Right Rev. Paul Moore Jr., retired bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of New York, performed the ceremony at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine.

Ms. McLaughlin, 27, is keeping her name. She graduated from New York University, and in September she plans to begin studying for a master's degree in organizational psychology at Columbia University Teachers College in New York. She is also working on a novel.

The bride is a daughter of Joan Lanier Austin of Rochester and Dr. John F. McLaughlin of Elmira, N.Y. Her father is a professor of philosophy at Elmira College. Her mother owns a landscape design company in Rochester bearing her name. The bride is a stepdaughter of Janet McLaughlin and David D. Austin.

Mr. Gibson, 26, is a senior technology officer at J. P. Morgan Chase & Company in New York, where he manages computer software development projects for the investment banking division. He graduated from the University of Virginia and is to become a student in the executive M.B.A. program at Columbia in September.
